noun.description: A bulbous Eurasian plant of a genus that includes the daffodil, especially (in gardening) one with flowers that have white or pale outer petals and a shallow orange or yellow cup in the center.

proper noun.description: A beautiful youth who rejected the nymph Echo and fell in love with his own reflection in a pool. He pined away and was changed into the flower that bears his name.

origin: Via Latin from Greek narkissos, perhaps from narkē numbness, with reference to its narcotic effects.
